intro: Caladiopsis, commonly known as the miniature caladium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features striking, heart-shaped leaves that come in a variety of colors, including green, red, and purple. Caladiopsis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade.
